=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: My Favorite Martian: Season 2
Review Date: 2016/02/18
Store: Ray Waltson  (Actor),     Bill Bixby  (Actor),     John L. Greene (creator)  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Indie & Art House
Product Description: ["MY FAVORITE MARTIAN marked the beginning of television's fascination with fantasy themed comedy series, originally airing on CBS-TV from 1963 to 1966 before being relaunched as a motion picture in 1999. Debuting in the top ten upon it's premiere season, MY FAVORITE MARTIAN stars Bill Bixby (THE COURTSHIP OF EDDIE'S FATHER, THE INCREDIBLE HULK) as newspaper reporter Tim O'Hara and Ray Walston (PICKET FENCES) as the Martian whom Tim discovers and passes off as his Uncle Martin. Pamela Britton plays their snoopy landlady, Lorelei Brown. MY FAVORITE MARTIAN Season Two Collector's Edition presents 38 complete, digitally remastered episodes along with special features. Among other classic TV actors who make guest appearances are Linda Evans, David White, Stafford Rebb, Pat Priest, Michael Constantine, Marge Redmond, Doris Packer, and Bernie Kopell."]
Average Rating: 4.3

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
This individual's purchasing behavior reveals a strong preference for nostalgic and classic television comedies, particularly those involving fantasy elements, as seen in multiple seasons of "My Favorite Martian" and other similar shows. They consistently rate such products highly, often awarding five-star ratings and expressing satisfaction with engaging content. Additionally, they appear to enjoy documentaries, showing a preference for educational and informative programming highlighted by the rating of documentaries on each state.

The reviews indicate selective quality standards, with an average rating of 4.4 or higher across various purchases, reflecting a desire for well-produced media. The individual shows moderate price sensitivity, as the purchases span across various price points but focus primarily on DVD collections and boxed sets—suggesting a preference for value in quantity and content richness. The reviews often exhibit positivity, even when ratings drop, indicating an overall appreciation for the genres and formats rather than a strict adherence to perfection.

Common themes include entertainment value, positive nostalgia, and an inclination toward multi-episode collections. Ultimately, the individual's core preferences center around classic comedies and structured documentaries, revealing a blend of comfort and curiosity in their media consumption choices.
